hero.title: Carlos Omaki
hero.subtitle: Tennis, method and legacy
hero.description: Competitive training for juniors and adults. Social projects and Brazilian tennis history.

philosophy.title: Philosophy in 3 Pillars
philosophy.subtitle: Methodology developed in 40 years of experience

meta.title: Philosophy - Carlos Omaki Tennis
meta.description: Discover the training philosophy that formed champions like Bia Haddad and Luisa Stefani

technique.title: Technical Excellence
technique.description: Solid fundamentals built from the ground up, with biomechanical correction and progressive development.

competition.title: Smart Competition
competition.description: Mental and tactical strategy to win not just with strength, but with game intelligence.

formation.title: Human Development
formation.description: Sports values applied to life: discipline, respect, resilience and teamwork.

method.title: The Omaki Method
method.description: A holistic approach combining refined technique, mental preparation and personal development.

step1.title: Individual Assessment
step1.description: Complete analysis of the athlete's physical, technical and psychological profile.

step2.title: Personalized Planning
step2.description: Development program adapted to each student's goals and potential.

step3.title: Supervised Execution
step3.description: Constant monitoring with real-time corrections and adjustments.

step4.title: Measurable Evolution
step4.description: Clear progress metrics and tangible on-court results.

excellence.title: Excellence
excellence.description: Constant pursuit of each athlete's best version.

respect.title: Respect
respect.description: Valuing opponents, rules and the sport.

evolution.title: Evolution
evolution.description: Continuous growth on and off the courts.

about.title: Carlos Omaki
about.intro: Leading coach in Brazilian tennis, with over 40 years dedicated to training champion athletes and developing the sport in the country.
about.description: My tennis journey began as an athlete and evolved into a mission: to form not just court champions, but successful people in life.

meta.title: About Carlos Omaki - 40 Years of Tennis
meta.description: Learn about Carlos Omaki's journey, a reference in Brazilian tennis

start.title: Beginning of the Journey
start.description: Started as an athlete and transitioned to coach, developing own methodology.

growth.title: Growth and Recognition
growth.description: Training first national and international champions.

legacy.title: Consolidated Legacy
legacy.description: National reference with athletes in the world professional circuit.

social.title: Social Impact
social.item2: Founding Director of Brazilian Tennis Memorial

meta.title: Tennis Programs - Carlos Omaki
meta.description: Training programs for all ages and levels

juniors.title: Competitive Juniors
juniors.description: Complete training for young athletes focused on state, national and international tournaments.
juniors.feature1: Technical and tactical training 5x per week

adults.title: Competitive Adults
adults.description: Intensive program for adult players seeking performance in tournaments and rankings.

clinics.title: Club Clinics
clinics.description: Specialized workshops and technical clinics for clubs, schools and groups.

online.title: Online Coaching
online.description: Technical analysis and tactical planning through videos and remote consultations.

meta.title: Social Projects - Carlos Omaki Tennis
meta.description: First Service Institute and Brazilian Tennis Memorial

institute.title: First Service Institute
institute.description: Democratizing access to quality tennis for youth from underprivileged communities, offering not just sports training, but also educational support and personal development.
institute.imageAlt: Young athletes from First Service Institute

programs.title: Programs Offered
programs.item1: Free sports initiation for youth aged 7 to 17
programs.item3: Values and citizenship formation through sports

memorial.title: Brazilian Tennis Memorial
memorial.description: Preserving history and celebrating national tennis achievements, the Memorial is a space for memory, research and inspiration for new generations.

impact.title: Real Impact
impact.subtitle: Numbers reflecting decades of dedication to tennis development and social transformation

results.title: Results that Speak
results.subtitle: Athletes trained by the Omaki method conquering the world

testimonials.title: Testimonials
testimonials.quote1: Carlos not only taught me how to play tennis, he taught me to be a competitor, to never give up and to always seek excellence. I owe much of my career to him.
